moves.1. e4 Nc6: Black is not challenging the center at all: so White must...
moves.2. f4: always liked this better, than d4...
moves.2... g5 3. d3 gxf4 4. Bxf4: this is, what we call free development...
moves.4... e6 5. Nf3 Bg7 6. c3: we look after the little ones...
moves.8. Be2 Nge7 9. O-O O-O 10. h3: preparing Nh2: time to rain down on Blacks' Kings' wing...
moves.10... d5 11. Nh2 Bxh3: clearly a miscalculation: opening up Whites' Kings' wing is immaterial...
moves.14. Nd2 Be3+ 15. Kg2 Ng6 16. Ndf3 Qe7: whatever attack Black is planning, it will be too late...
moves.17. Nh4 Nf4+ 18. Bxf4 Bxf4 19. Nf5: the threat is clear: take out Bf4, and then Nh6+...
moves.19... Qf7: this move took me by surprise: after Bh5, Black has nothing, not even check; after Nh6+, Bxh6 (forced), Bh5, Qg7+, Kh1, Black is in big trouble after Rg1: so I gambled...
moves.20. Nh6+: after Bxh6, Bh5, etcetera: see above variation...
moves.20... Kh8: what can I say? I would say, that Black resigns...

gameName: the way of forcing a win...
